text_value: Serrano del Rosal, Rafael; Biedma Velázquez, Lourdes; García Rodríguez, Mª Isabel; Serrano Gemes, Gema; Cerrillo Vidal, José Antonio; García González, Juan Manuel; Blanco Hungría, Antonio; 2025; Social Legitimacy of Pain (SOLEPA). Survey Study [Dataset]; DIGITAL.CSIC; https://doi.org/10.20350/digitalCSIC/17221

[Description of methods used for collection/generation of data] UNIVERSE: Population residing in Spain aged 18 and over. FRAME: 40dB panel. SAMPLE SIZE: 1,600 interviews. DATA COLLECTION: The sample has been selected among the people belonging to the Panel. SAMPLE TYPE: Stratified selection by age group, sex and educational level of the Panel members, with the strata being proportional to the national population over 18 years of age. AVERAGE INTERVIEW TIME: 13.8 minutes.

[Methods for processing the data] The treatment of the information collected consisted of debugging the data, correcting errors and detecting anomalous data. Data recording was automatic and coding of open-ended questions was done manually. The evaluation of the fieldwork was continued by reviewing the compliance of the sample, analysis and treatment of non-response.
The codebook is available in Spanish and in English translation.
[EN] The "Social Legitimacy of Pain" project aims to delve into the understanding of pain from a social perspective.
[ES] El proyecto “Legitimidad social del Dolor”, tiene por objeto ahondar en el conocimiento del dolor desde una perspectiva social.
Funded by the State Program for I+D+i Oriented to the Challenges of Society (RTI2018-099483-B-I00).
